Detailed Description

CKeyListener class enables and disables the key capturing feature.

CKeyListener class object is constructed when the opcode OPCODE_START_KEYCAPTURE is received from the proxy. This class is responsible for enabling and disabling of the key capturing fuctionality on the mobile phone. This class is also an active object.

Member Function Documentation

void CKeyListener::ConstructL (  CCodeListener *  aCodeListener,
RFileLogger *  aLog
) 
 

CKeyListener class second level constructor.

This methods initializes couple of class members with the parameters passed and adds CKeyListener object to the Active Scheduler.

Parameters:
aCodeListener as CCodeListener object pointer.
aLog as RFileLogger object pointer.

void CKeyListener::DoCancel (   )  [private]
 

Cancels all the pending wait requests.

This method cancels all the pending wait requests for the key events.

void CKeyListener::InterceptKeys (   )  [private]
 

Registers for capturing keys.

This method registers to capture keys from the mobile phone. It is invoked once.

void CKeyListener::RunL (   )  [private]
 

Callback method from the CActiveScheduler.

This method is a callback method which is invoked by the Active Scheduler on completion of an unsynchronized request. In this context this request is waiting for a key events. This method upon receiving the key event initiates the process of relaying it to the "iStuff Mobile" proxy.

void CKeyListener::StartL (   ) 
 

Starts capturing key presses.

This method starts capturing key presses from the mobile phone.

void CKeyListener::StopL (   ) 
 

Stops capturing key presses.

This method stops capturing key presses from the mobile phone.
